basics.name: Pedro Fontanarrosa TEST
basics.label: Multidisciplinary Researcher & Software Engineer in Synthetic Biology
basics.summary: Broadly skilled researcher with a strong foundation in computational/software engineering and biological sciences. I have extensive experience developing Genetic Design Automation (GDA) tools and mathematical models for genetic circuit design during my Master's and PhD research. As a postdoc at UCL, I am expanding into advanced machine learning algorithm development—designing custom Gaussian process regression kernels, applying Bayesian inference with VAR regression for time-series analysis, and developing physics-informed neural networks to infer biological system dynamics. I excel in remote, multidisciplinary collaborations.

work.name: Computational Systems and Synthetic Biology Lab, University College London
work.summary: As a Postdoctoral Researcher at UCL, I focus on developing and enhancing Python packages tailored for modeling, inference, and design of biological systems. I create and adapt CI/CD pipelines to streamline our software development lifecycle for computational biology, while applying and advancing machine learning techniques—including Gaussian processes, neural networks, and VAR models—and Bayesian optimization methods to improve the design and analysis of complex biological systems.
highlights: Developing robust Python packages for genetic design automation and modeling inference
Creating and adapting CI/CD pipelines for scalable computational biology workflows
Applying and advancing machine learning (GP, VAR, NN) and Bayesian optimization algorithms to enhance predictive modeling and system design

work.name: Genetic Logic Lab, University of Boulder
work.summary: Developed Genetic Design Automation (GDA) tools and mathematical models for synthetic biology. Focused on computational methods for genetic circuit simulation and design in a collaborative, interdisciplinary setting.
highlights: Enhanced iBioSim functionalities for genetic circuit modeling
Developed robust mathematical models for genetic design
Collaborated with international research teams using cloud-based tools

work.name: University of Utah
work.summary: Conducted advanced research in Biomedical Engineering (Synthetic Biology Track) focused on developing computational models and GDA tools for genetic circuit design. Emphasized mathematical modeling and simulation to support experimental research.
highlights: Developed and refined computational models for genetic regulatory networks
Supported experimental design with simulation-based predictions
Collaborated on interdisciplinary projects in synthetic biology

work.name: COMBINE Standards
work.summary: Curated and maintained the Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) standard for representing biological designs. Coordinated change proposals and supported the development of software libraries and community documentation.
highlights: Led weekly meetings to coordinate SBOL standard updates
Facilitated community-driven revisions and improvements to SBOL
Enhanced interoperability in synthetic biology data exchange

work.name: University of Utah
work.summary: Performed research in Bioengineering (Synthetic Biology Track) focusing on early-stage development of computational tools for genetic design. Collaborated with faculty and peers on mathematical modeling and simulation projects.
highlights: Contributed to the development of preliminary GDA tools
Assisted in mathematical modeling of genetic circuits
Engaged in interdisciplinary research in synthetic biology

work.name: Northlands School
work.summary: Taught chemistry to high school students and coordinated Extended Essays in chemical research.
highlights: Developed lesson plans that enhanced student engagement in scientific topics
Mentored students in chemical research projects

work.name: Tarbut School
work.summary: Taught science and mathematics to primary and high school students and organized Mathematical Ingenious Olympiads.
highlights: Designed and implemented creative educational programs
Coordinated school-wide science and math competitions

work.name: Evolutionary Studies Laboratory, University of Buenos Aires
work.summary: Conducted research in genetics and ecology, including maintaining Drosophila isogenetic lines, coordinating field expeditions, managing statistical programs and databases, and mentoring lab members.
highlights: Coordinated field expeditions and permit negotiations
Managed statistical programs and databases
Trained new laboratory members

awards.title: Fulbright and Argentine Presidential Fellowship in Science & Technology
awards.awarder: Argentine President’s Cabinet & U.S. Embassy of Buenos Aires
awards.summary: Awarded to pursue a master’s degree in the United States starting Fall 2017.

awards.title: Research and Communication Excellency Award
awards.awarder: Ministry of Science and Technology, Argentinean government
awards.summary: Recognized for excellence in research and communication under the 'Beca Estímulo' scholarship.

awards.title: Beca Estímulo (Encouragement Scholarship)
awards.summary: Supported research and development tasks in genetics and ecology.

publications.name: Evaluating the Contribution of Model Complexity in Predicting Robustness in Synthetic Genetic Circuits
publications.summary: An analysis of how model complexity impacts the robustness of synthetic genetic circuits.

publications.name: Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) Version 3.1.0
publications.summary: Describes the implementation and features of SBOL version 3.1.0 for standardized data exchange in bioengineering.

certificates.name: Machine Learning A-Z™: AI, Python & R + ChatGPT Bonus [2023]
Optimization with Python: Solve Operations Research Problems
Optimization with Python: Complete Pyomo Bootcamp A-Z
Modern Web Scraping with Python using Scrapy Splash Selenium
Pyomo Bootcamp: Python Optimization from Beginner to Advance
Theory of Gaussian Process Regression for Machine Learning

volunteer.summary: Organized talks, workshops, hackathons, and DIY projects to promote innovation in science, engineering, and synthetic biology.
highlights: Organized hackathons for SBOL and FAIR data practices
Coordinated interdisciplinary teams and managed remote collaboration

volunteer.organization: University of Buenos Aires Biology Week
volunteer.summary: Coordinated the annual Biology Week to promote science careers among high school students.

volunteer.organization: Data-Centric Biological Design & Engineering Interest Group
volunteer.summary: Organize a monthly seminar series under the Alan Turing Institute's banner to leverage AI in advancing biological system engineering. The group unites experts from computer science, biology, and engineering to address global challenges in sustainable manufacturing, healthcare innovation, and environmental impact.

projects.name: Synergistic Discovery and Design (SD2)
projects.description: Genetic circuit design for extreme environments enabled by models extracted from petabyte+ perturbation analyses.

projects.name: SBOL Standard Contribution
projects.description: Contributed to the development of SBOL, a free and open-source standard for representing biological designs.

projects.name: iBioSim Development
projects.description: Worked on iBioSim—a CAD tool for modeling, analysis, and design of genetic circuits supporting SBML and SBOL, including capabilities for multicellular and spatial models.

projects.name: Advanced Machine Learning for Biological Systems
projects.description: Developing and applying novel machine learning algorithms to model and predict the structure and dynamics of biological systems. Techniques include custom Gaussian process regression with covariance (kernel) designs, Bayesian inference with VAR regression for time-series analysis, and physics-informed neural networks for scalable inference with limited samples. Originally applied to microbial systems, these methods are generalizable to any biological system.

sideProjects.name: Detecting Fake News
sideProjects.description: A machine learning project that uses advanced algorithms to detect fake news. Developed in Python and hosted on GitHub.

sideProjects.name: Arduino & Electronics Projects
sideProjects.description: Hobby projects involving Arduino and other electronic platforms to create interactive hardware solutions.
